name: Introduction to Journalism
description: This course provides an introduction to the fundamentals of journalism. Students will learn basic journalistic principles, ethics, and techniques.

name: Broadcast Writing
description: This course provides an introduction to the writing style and techniques used in broadcast journalism. Students will learn how to write for television and radio, as well as the basics of script formatting and writing for various media platforms.

name: Broadcast Research and Reporting
description: This course provides an introduction to the research and reporting techniques used in broadcast journalism. Students will learn how to research and report stories, as well as the basics of fact-checking and interviewing.

name: Broadcast Editing and Production
description: This course provides an introduction to the editing and production techniques used in broadcast journalism. Students will learn how to edit and produce stories for television and radio, as well as the basics of audio and video editing.

name: Broadcast Journalism Capstone
description: This capstone course provides an opportunity for students to apply the concepts and skills learned in the broadcast journalism courses to create a professional-quality broadcast. Students will develop and execute a multimedia project from concept to completion.
